summary: Voice-recording app with a 1–90 numbered interface, where each number’s recording plays back only for that exact number (no partial/substring matches).

existing_features.title: Ensure host-recorded audio clips are only used for the exact selected/drawn number (1–90) and never unintentionally triggered for other numbers (e.g., clip for 1 must not play when announcing 12, 13, 41, etc.).

Update the voice announcement playback sequencing so that in “digits-then-number” reading mode, digit steps always use TTS (never host recordings), while the final full-number step may use host recordings according to the selected voice source priority.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build voice-recording UI for numbers 1–90 (record/play controls per number)
Ensure playback matches the exact selected number only (e.g., 1 does not match 12/13/41); apply to all 1–90

Keep (or recreate if missing) a “Host Voice Recordings” manager UI matching the uploaded screenshot: a dialog titled “Host Voice Recordings” with instructions, a scrollable 1–90 grid, per-number record/stop controls, and per-number play/delete controls when a recording exists, plus a recorded count badge and close button.

projectName: Host voice recordings: exact number-matched playback (no digit/substring collisions)
